plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning clusters of pale pink to white flowers that bloom profusely in early spring. Widely celebrated in Japan during sakura festivals, these blossoms symbolize renewal and the transient beauty of life.
plants.location: Japan, East Asia, temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Japanese Cherry Blossoms have a very short blooming period, usually lasting only one to two weeks before the petals fall, creating beautiful pink carpets on the ground.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub producing large, fragrant clusters of flowers ranging from white and pink to red. Oleanders are drought-tolerant and bloom from spring through fall in warm climates, often used in landscaping in Mediterranean and subtropical areas.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern USA, subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested, containing cardiac glycosides that can affect the heart.
